name: Hard Egypt - Middle Period Quiz / Test | Ancient History | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Pharaoh of Egypt established his capital at Thebes and reunited the land during his reign, beginning the middle period of ancient Egyptian history?
questions.explanation:
Menthu-Hotep I.

	Menthu-Hotep is recognized as the founder of the 11th Dynasty and reigned for a glorious 51 years...uniting Egypt under his rule. His mummy was found near Thebes in 1827.

questions.text: A powerful Vizier quickly ended the reign of this Pharaoh's son, and established himself as Pharaoh, beginning the 12th Dynasty. Who was this fellow?
questions.explanation:
Ammenemes.

	Ammenemes was a prolific builder of monuments, beginning the construction of the great temple at Karnak.

questions.text: During this dynasty, the Heliopolitan god Re was united with the Theban god, creating a new national god for Egypt. What was the god of Thebes called?
questions.explanation:
Amon.

	From this time, Pharaohs became known as the sons of Amon-Re.

questions.text: During this 12th Dynasty, a major territorial acquisition was made by the Egyptians. Which area was overwhelmed by Egyptian power in this era?
questions.explanation:
Nubia.

	Nubia became a province of Egypt under the great reign of Ammenemes I, mentioned above.

questions.text: The 17th century brought new rulers to Lower Egypt, as the power of the Theban kings began to decline. Who were these newcomers to the realm of the Pharaohs?
questions.explanation:
Hyksos.

	The origin of the Hyksos remains a mystery. They could be some offshoot Indo-European tribe, the original Palestinians, the original Hebrews or any number of other possibilities.

questions.text: Which of the following was not brought with this new Asiatic people to the land of Pharaohs?
questions.explanation:
Irrigation Techniques.

	One thing we do know about the Hyksos is that they were well-endowed with weapons and were firmly ensconced in the bronze age.

questions.text: What was the name of the Egyptian king who brought native rule back to Egypt?
questions.explanation:
Kamose.

	The brother of Kamose, Ahmose, would become the founder of the great 18th Dynasty!

questions.text: Which of the following reflects the proper introduction of Egyptian scripts in terms of time order?
questions.explanation:
Hieroglyphic, Hieratic, Demotic, Coptic.

	The evolution of these scripts follows a slow procession from pictographs to alphabet. The Coptic script reflects the powerful influence of Greek.

questions.text: What is the best known tale of the Middle Kingdom of Egypt?
questions.explanation:
The Story of Sinuhe.

	'The Story of Sinuhe' was a romantic tale set during the reign of Sesostris I and very much promoted the glory of said Pharaoh.

questions.text: True or false: The ancient Egyptians believed in life after death.
questions.explanation:
True & T.

	Which is why they mummified the bodies of their dead. This belief is a departure from other ancient civilizations, such as Sumer, which did not share in the belief in an afterlife.
